Title: common.setup
Description: Noun, as in "Viewing a Setup screen"

Title: common.setUpVerb
Description: Verb, as in "How to Set Up this product"

Title: app.description
en-US: Real-time captioning for your event, speech, classroom lecture, or church service.

Title: captioner.saveToFile.description
en-US: Save your current transcript to a file.

Title: captioner.saveToFile.transcriptEmptyMessage
en-US: Psst... you know you don't have anything to save yet, right?

Title: googleCast.cast
Description: Short for the Google Cast brand.

Title: googleCast.castingToReceiver
Description: Do not translate {receiverName}. The name of the selected Chromecast receiver will be inserted at that point.

Title: navbar.captioner.listeningToMicrophone
Description: Do not translate {microphoneName}. The microphone name will be inserted at that point.

Title: navbar.menu.about
Description: Do not translate. This is a reference to another phrase.

Title: navbar.menu.newWindowDescription
Description: Do not translate. This is a reference to another phrase.

Title: navbar.menu.saveToFile
Description: Do not translate. This is a reference to another phrase.

Title: navbar.vmixNotConnected
Description: Use title case. "vMix" is the name for the vMix streaming software.

Title: settings.other
Description: Refers to an "Other" category of settings.

Title: settings.about.whatsNewInWebCaptioner
Description: Do not translate @:app.webCaptioner. The text with the identifier app.webCaptioner will be inserted at that point.

Title: settings.eventLog.instructions.i0
Description: Do not translate {sendItToMeOnFacebook} in this phrase. The text located at settings.eventLog.instructions.sendItToMeOnFacebook will be inserted into this point.
en-US: Reproduce the issue you were having, and then copy this log and {sendItToMeOnFacebook}. The log includes the content of your current transcription, if any. You can leave this page and continue to use Web Captioner like normal.

Title: settings.eventLog.instructions.i1
Description: Do not translate {loggingDurationMinutes}. A number will be inserted at that point.
en-US: For performance reasons, logging will automatically shut off after {loggingDurationMinutes} minutes. You can still copy the log after it shuts off as long as you don't reload the page.

Title: settings.eventLog.instructions.sendItToMeOnFacebook
en-US: send it to me on Facebook

Title: settings.eventLog.loggingTurnsOffIn
Description: Do not translate {timeRemainingMinutes} or {timeRemainingSeconds}. Numbers will be inserted at both of those points.

Title: settings.eventLog.loggingOff
Description: Short for the phrase "Logging is currently off". Refers to a system event log used to troubleshoot issues internally in Web Captioner.

Title: settings.eventLog.eventsHidden
Description: Do not translate {notShowingCount}. A number will be inserted there.
en-US: {notShowingCount} events are hidden, but they'll be included when you copy the log.

Title: settings.eventLog.events
Description: Separate three phrases by pipe characters (|): A phrase to show when there are no events; a phrase for when there is exactly one event, and a phrase when there is more than one event.

Title: settings.experiments.description
Description: Do not translate {email} or {messageMeOnFacebook}. {email} will be replaced with an email address and {messageMeOnFacebook} will be replaced with the translated phrase located at the key settings.experiments.messageMeOnFacebook.
en-US: Be sure to help out and give me feedback about experiments! Email me at {email} or {messageMeOnFacebook}.

Title: settings.experiments.addExperimentConfirmation
Description: Do not translate {experimentName}. The name of the experiment being added will be inserted at that point.
en-US: Do you want to add the "{experimentName}" experiment?

Title: settings.experiments.alreadyAdded
Description: Do not translate {alreadyAddedExperimentName}. The name of the experiment  will be inserted at that point.

Title: settings.appearance.interimTextColorDescription
en-US: During captioning, words that have just been recognized may change slightly while Web Captioner determines the context of the current phrase. Those words will be this color.

Title: settings.appearance.firstLetterOfEachWord
Description: Capitalize the first letter of each word in this text.

Title: settings.appearance.properNouns
en-US: Proper nouns and the start of sentences

Title: settings.appearance.properNounsDescription
en-US: Separate sentences are detected only when a puncuation mark like "period" or "question mark" is literally said.

Title: settings.censor.censorProfaneLanguageDescription.text
Description: Do not translate {seeThisList} or {useWordReplacement}. The text at the key settings.censor.censorProfaneLanguageDescription.seeThisList and settings.censor.censorProfaneLanguageDescription.useWordReplacements will be placed here, respectively.
en-US: What's considered profane? {seeThisList} (note: profanity ahead!) If you need to censor additional words not included in this list, {useWordReplacements}.

Title: settings.controls.largerDescription
en-US: Larger controls and additional buttons for one-click saving and clearing the transcript

Title: settings.controls.then
Description: Used in explaining a sequence of key presses to execute a keyboard shortcut. Example: "w then c"

Title: settings.controls.showNewWindow
en-US: Show captions in a new window

Title: settings.controls.openSave
Description: The value of captioner.saveToFile.title is inserted between the double quotes. Do not translate "@:captioner.saveToFile.title"

Title: settings.language.interfaceDescription
en-US: Select a language for the Web Captioner interface (menus, messages, and settings pages).

Title: settings.language.wouldYouLikeYourLanguage
en-US: Would you like your language here? {contactWebCaptionerOnFacebook} if you're interested in helping to translate Web Captioner. Thanks for all of your awesome help! {heartIcon}

Title: settings.language.spokenDescription.text
Description: Do not translate {supportedLanguagesAndDialects}. The text located at settings.language.spokenDescription.supportedLanguagesAndDialects will be placed here.
en-US: Web Captioner will recognize speech in this language. Learn more about {supportedLanguagesAndDialects}.

Title: settings.wordReplacements.description
en-US: Replace or hide specific words or phrases during captioning.

Title: settings.wordReplacements.wordOrPhraseToReplaceDescription
en-US: Separate multiple words or phrases with commas. Not case sensitive.

Title: settings.vmix.vmix
Description: Name of the vMix streaming software.

Title: settings.vmix.description.text
Description: {vMix} will link to the vMix website. {visitTheHelpCenter} links to https://webcaptioner.com/vmix
en-US: {vMix} is a popular software video mixer and switcher. You can send text directly to vMix and display it in a title input. You can then use vMix's font and color controls to style captioned text. {visitTheHelpCenter} to learn more.

Title: settings.vmix.captionsWillAppear
en-US: {startCaptioning} and your captions will now appear in vMix.

Title: settings.vmix.installChromeExtensionDescription
en-US: The Web Captioner Connector extension for Google Chrome lets Web Captioner connect to vMix.

Title: settings.vmix.vmixWebController
Description: Use title case. This refers to a feature called "Web Controller" in vMix. Unless vMix has a localized name for Web Controller in the language being translated to, prefer to use "Web Controller".

Title: settings.vmix.enableVmixWebControllerInstructions
en-US: In vMix, go to {settingMenu}. Check the box to enable the {webController}. Specify a port number or accept the default.

Title: settings.vmix.provideAddress
en-US: Provide the address that appears in vMix:

Title: settings.vmix.cannotConnect
en-US: Cannot connect to vMix at "{webControllerAddress}". Make sure Web Controller is enabled in vMix and that you've copied over the website address correctly. It should look something like this: http://192.168.1.1:8080

Title: settings.vmix.importTitleTemplateLonger
en-US: Import the Web Captioner Title Template into vMix

Title: settings.vmix.importTitleTemplateInstructions.i1
Description: Do not translate text in curly braces.

Title: settings.vmix.importTitleTemplateInstructions.i2
Description: Do not translate text in curly braces.
en-US: In the {inputSelect} window, click {browse} in the upper right and open the Web Captioner title template you downloaded.

Title: settings.vmix.importTitleTemplateInstructions.i3
Description: Do not translate text in curly braces.
en-US: The title will appear in the {recent} tab. Double-click it.

Title: settings.vmix.importTitleTemplateInstructions.i4
Description: Do not translate text in curly braces.
en-US: In the Title Editor that appears, optionally customize font and text size. Close it when you are finished.

Title: settings.vmix.cantFindTemplate
en-US: Web Captioner can connect to vMix, but it can't find the Web Captioner title template in an input.

Title: settings.exportRestore.restoreDescription
en-US: Restore settings (appearance, censor settings, word replacements, vMix settings, etc.) from a settings file you previously exported.

Title: settings.exportRestore.somethingWrongWithFile
en-US: It looks like something's wrong with that file.

Title: settings.exportRestore.settingsWillBeLost
en-US: All of your current settings will be lost.

Title: settings.exportRestore.exportDescription
en-US: Your settings will be saved locally as a JSON file.

Title: incompatibleBrowser.message.i0
en-US: Sorry, but currently Web Captioner only works in Google Chrome.

Title: incompatibleBrowser.message.i1
Description: Do not translate text in curly braces.
en-US: You can still look around and play with settings, but in order to start captioning, you'll have to {switchToGoogleChrome}.

Title: incompatibleBrowser.message.i2
Description: Do not translate text in curly braces.
en-US: If compatibility with browsers other than Chrome is important to you, {castAVoteHere}.
